title: Anastasius I Dicorus
summary: Anastasius I Dicorus (Greek: Ἀναστάσιος Anastásios; c. 431 – 9 July 518) was Byzantine emperor  from 491 to 518. He made his career as a government administrator. He came to the throne at the age of 61 after being chosen by the wife of his predecessor, Zeno. His religious tendencies caused tensions throughout his reign.[2]
